;

;周三早些时候，奥蒂斯飓风以 5 级风暴的形式袭击了墨西哥海滩度假胜地阿卡普尔科，袭击了酒店并导致游客流离失所当飓风以暴雨和狂风袭击南太平洋海岸时，人们纷纷寻找掩护。

;

;社交媒体上发布的视频显示，飓风经过时房间被毁，天花板和墙壁裂开，汽车部分淹没在洪水中南部格雷罗州醒悟到奥蒂斯死后留下的混乱。

;

;社交媒体上来自一家医院的视频显示，护士们将病人从病房疏散，以确保他们免受奥蒂斯的伤害，奥蒂斯在海上的情况出人意料地迅速加强。奥蒂斯以每小时 165 英里（266 公里/小时）的风速冲入海岸。

;

;奥蒂斯是该地区有史以来最强的飓风之一，到达海岸时强度为 5 级，随后迅速减弱为 5 级4 风暴。随着向内陆移动，风力进一步减弱，到上午中旬已达到 1 级强度。

;

;总统安德烈斯·曼努埃尔·洛佩兹·奥夫拉多尔表示，目前还没有关于风暴造成人员死亡的报告，但警告说，当局正在努力获取最新消息.

;

;“飓风仍在影响该地区，通讯完全中断，”他在政府例行新闻发布会上告诉记者。

;

;奥蒂斯仍在格雷罗州上空，并将继续墨西哥国家水务机构 CONAGUA 在一份声明中表示，该地区大部分地区将出现大雨。

;

;墨西哥民防部门报告称，格雷罗州全境停电，往返阿卡普尔科的航班暂停，课程取消。奥蒂斯震慑了酒店，迫使游客进入避难所。

;

;当地时间上午 9 点左右（格林尼治标准时间 1500），奥蒂斯位于阿卡普尔科西北偏北 100 英里（160 公里）处，风速为每小时 80 英里美国国家飓风中心称，风速为每小时 129 公里。

;

;然而，它仍然带来每小时 110 英里（177 公里）的风，给大片地区带来强降雨和洪水，飓风强度为大范围。墨西哥南部。

;

;奥蒂斯可能会给格雷罗州和瓦哈卡州部分地区带来高达 20 英寸（51 厘米）的降雨、泥石流、“潜在灾难性”风暴潮以及危及生命的海浪和离岸流当局称，情况不佳。

;

;CONAGUA 警告格雷罗州和瓦哈卡州部分地区有 6 至 8 米（20 至 26 英尺）的海浪。

;

;在格雷罗州，当局掀起了风暴。洛佩兹·奥夫拉多尔周二晚表示，当士兵们在阿卡普尔科空荡荡的海滩巡逻时，国防部在风暴到来之前制定了灾难计划。

;;FTX 前首席执行官 Sam Bankman-Fried 因加密货币交易所破产而面临欺诈指控，他在曼哈顿听证会后离开美国纽约市联邦法院，2023 年 1 月 3 日。路透社/Andrew Kelly/档案照片;
;

;山姆·班克曼-弗里德 (Sam Bankman-Fried) 计划在刑事欺诈审判中为自己辩护作证，此前他最亲密的同事将去年 11 月 FTX 加密货币交易所的倒闭归咎于这位前亿万富翁。

;

;在周三与负责曼哈顿联邦法院案件的美国地区法官刘易斯·卡普兰 (Lewis Kaplan) 举行的电话会议上，班克曼-弗里德的律师马克·科恩表示，辩方计划在检察官陈述案情后传唤其他三名证人作证。

;

;“我们的当事人也将出庭作证，”科恩说。

;< p>;出庭作证可能会让班克曼-弗里德获得许可，他已;提出抗辩; 欺诈和共谋指控不成立，面对面告诉陪审员，虽然他在运营 FTX 时犯了错误，但他从未打算窃取客户的钱。

;

;作证会带来重大风险，并且检察官可能会对 31 岁的班克曼-弗里德进行严厉的盘问，检察官会携带文件、信息和合作证人的证词，他们可以利用这些文件、信息和证人的证词来攻击他的可信度。

;

;尽管如此，班克曼-弗里德还是喜欢冒险。被捕后公开讨论此案的意愿可能反映了他对自己能够;作证;他指示他们犯罪，并且知道他的对冲基金 Alameda Research 在未经 FTX 客户同意的情况下从 FTX 客户那里拿走了数十亿美元。

;

;检察官表示，Bankman-Fried 用这些钱来支撑 Alameda、进行投机投资和捐赠向美国政治候选人和竞选活动提供了超过 1 亿美元。

;

;自审判开始以来的三周内，他们试图证明 Bankman-Fried 意图欺骗他的客户、阿拉米达贷款机构和 FTX 股权投资者。< /p>;

;辩护律师表示，检察官所说的一些相当于盗窃客户资金的活动，例如授予 Alameda 在 FTX 上交易的特权，是 Bankman-Fried 当时做出的合理商业决策。

;

; >;

;他们还试图将 FTX 的倒闭归咎于 Bankman-Fried 的核心圈子，包括他的前女友兼 Alameda 首席执行官卡罗琳·埃里森 (Caroline Ellison)，并表示他们修改了证词，希望获得从轻处罚。

;

;在证人席上，Bankman-Fried 可能必须出庭作证，证明他曾与前同事谈论 Alameda 对 FTX 客户的巨额债务。

;

;他可能还必须解释之前向陪审员展示的短信，表明他;当他在 Twitter 上发帖时就知道资金短缺;科恩表示，就在该交易所倒闭前几天，尽管取款量不断增加，FTX 仍然“很好”。

;

;科恩表示，其他辩护证人可能包括一名数据库专家、一名记录保管员和首席证券监管机构克里斯蒂娜·罗尔 (Christina Rolle)位于 FTX 总部所在地巴哈马。

;

;检察官预计将于周四上午结案。科恩表示，辩方可能会在周五结束案件，具体取决于检察官的盘问持续多长时间。结案陈词最早可能在周一开始。

;

;一个亲属代表团访问了罗马，与包括总理乔治亚·梅洛尼在内的当局举行会谈，作为支持世界的运动的一部分努力解救 200 多人被俘。

;

;这群人中包括 Avi Eylon，她 23 岁的女儿 Shira 在参加音乐节时与朋友一起被杀。

;< p>;与希拉的妹妹阿达尔坐在意大利首都的一家酒店里，他说对他的家人来说已经太晚了，但人质必须回家。

;

;“请醒来。对意大利的人们世界，欧洲人民，请醒来，因为这不是土地冲突，这是宗教冲突，”他告诉路透社，并表示哈马斯谋杀他女儿的原因是她是犹太人。

;

;以色列南部袭击造成 1,400 人死亡，约 222 人被劫持为人质。继周五释放两名拥有美国和以色列双重国籍的人质后，哈马斯于周一释放了两名以色列平民妇女。

;

;哈马斯控制的加沙地带的卫生官员表示，自以色列建国以来，已有 6,500 多人被杀。其轰炸行动作为回应。

;

;三人拥有双重身份;意大利裔以色列公民;在 10 月 7 日的哈马斯袭击中丧生，其中包括 Eviatar Moshe Kipnis 和他的妻子 Lilian Le Havron，他们都在 ;Beeri; 基布兹，主要目标之一。

;

;他们的儿子 Nadav，他也在袭击中失去了他的叔叔，来到意大利要求采取行动释放所有人质，其中包括他的几名家人。

;

;“这些人只是平民，不应该遭受这些创伤事件，他说：“以色列本身只能将哈马斯视为恐怖组织，但（以色列）无法与他们谈判，”表示卡塔尔和埃及等国将有能力向哈马斯施压，要求其释放人质。

;

;他表示，令人遗憾的是，一些走上欧洲街头支持巴勒斯坦的示威者在当伊斯兰暴力再次袭击法国和比利时时，哈马斯得到了支持。

;

;“哈马斯为自由而战的说法是错误的，”他说。 “哈马斯正在与其他宗教作战。”

;陨石撞击;火星;从美国宇航局洞察号着陆器所在的位置提供了有关这颗红色星球深层内部的新线索，促使科学家重新评估解剖结构地球的行星邻居。

;

;新的地震数据表明，在;液态金属核心; - 行星最内部的组成部分 - 比;研究人员周三表示，之前估计;。

;

;地震产生的波浪 - 包括 ;陨石撞击; - 当穿过行星内的不同物质时，陨石撞击的速度和形状各不相同。来自洞察号地震仪仪器的数据使地球的内部结构变得清晰起来。

;

;2021 年 9 月 18 日，火星高地地区坦佩泰拉 (Tempe Terra) 发生的陨石撞击引发了 4.2 级地震，并引发了强烈地震。一个宽约 425 英尺（130 米）的陨石坑。它发生在火星的另一侧，与洞察号所在的极乐世界平原地区不同。

;

;“远侧撞击的重要性在于产生穿过火星内部深处的地震波，包括瑞士苏黎世联邦理工学院的行星科学家、两篇科学论文之一的主要作者阿米尔·汗 (Amir Khan) 表示：“此前，我们没有观察到任何穿过地核的地震波。我们只看到了来自地核顶部的反射。”新发现发表在;Nature;杂志上。

;

;波浪的行为表明，之前对火星内部的评估遗漏了一些东西——核心周围存在约 90 英里（150 公里）厚的熔融硅酸盐层。这个熔融区域位于地球内部称为地幔的底部。

;

;研究人员还重新计算了地核的大小，发现其直径约为 2,080 英里（3,350 公里），其体积比之前认为的小约 30%。

;

;研究人员表示，地幔（夹在地球最外层地壳和地核之间的岩石层）延伸至地表以下约 1,055 英里（1,700 公里）。与火星不同，地球的核心周围没有熔融层。周三发表的两项研究之一表明该层已完全熔化，另一项表明其大部分已完全熔化，顶部部分部分熔化。

;

;“熔化层和部分熔化层本质上是法国国家研究中心地球物理研究所的行星科学家亨利·塞缪尔说：“它由硅酸盐（岩石形成矿物）组成，与上面的固体地幔相比，富含铁和放射性产热元素。” de Paris 是;第二项研究;的主要作者。

;<火星核心主要由铁和镍组成，但也有一些较轻的元素，如硫、氧、碳和氢。研究人员得出的结论是，这些较轻的元素按重量计约占地核成分的 9-15%，低于之前的估计。

;

;“这种轻元素的含量与地核的含量没有什么不同，地核的含量是估计约为 10%。”Khan 说。

;

;火星是距太阳第四远的行星，其直径约为 4,220 英里（6,791 公里），而地球直径约为 7,926 英里（12,755 公里） ）。地球的总体积几乎是地球的七倍。

;

;US President Joe Biden welcomed Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to the White House on Wednesday to talk defense and China strategy, but the ;growing Middle East crisis; took center stage.

;

;"You have spoken with moral clarity, and you have stood up for a simple principle - the principle that every innocent life matters, Israeli and Palestinian,” Albanese said on the White House lawn about Biden's approach to the crisis.

;

;"American leadership is indispensable, but it is not inevitable," he added. "It takes a leader to deliver it…it takes true leadership to seek peace, because protecting innocent people is not a show of weakness, it is a measure of strength."

;

;A growing chorus of nations are pushing Israel to take a humanitarian pause in its attacks on Hamas in Gaza that have killed thousands of Palestinians, many of them children. ;

;Australia is a key ally in the Pacific, and Biden scheduled the visit after ;canceling a trip to Sydney; in May to stay in Washington and negotiate a government funding crisis.

;

;The US-Australia partnership is "an alliance that is marked by imagination, ingenuity and innovation," Biden told the prime minister in opening remarks upon his arrival at the US presidential complex in Washington, citing their partnership on World War One, World War Two and the war on terror.

;

;The visit is expected to result in agreements aimed at deterring and competing with China, even as separately the two countries try to thaw relations with Beijing. The two nations are committed to making sure the "Indopacific remains free, open, prosperous and secure," Biden said.

;

;Albanese, greeted with a red carpet, military bands and a receiving line of Biden's top advisers, praised American democratic values and lauded Biden for maintaining "that every innocent life matters, Israeli and Palestinian, and that in every conflict every effort must be made to protect civilians."

;

;He also pledged continued cooperation in Ukraine's ongoing fight against Russia's invasion last year.

;

;The expected deals include launching an ;undersea internet cable project; and maritime wharf infrastructure investment designed to benefit and woo Pacific Island nations whose assistance may be needed to respond to any future ;conflict over Taiwan; or the South China Sea, according to US officials.

;

;Washington and Canberra, already partners in a decades-old collective defense agreement, will also announce wider security cooperation with Japan.

;

;The balancing act of strengthening deterrence against China without offending Beijing too much is made more complicated by a Middle East crisis that has again diverted Washington's attention away from the Indo-Pacific.

;

;A leadership vacuum in the US House of Representatives has also complicated the approval of a set of laws needed to deliver on Biden's promise to support the AUKUS defense partnership between the United States, Britain and Australia. The AUKUS deal includes transferring sensitive US and British nuclear submarine technology to Australia.

;

;Financing and approvals related to AUKUS still need to come from Congress, where Republican lawmakers, who have a narrow majority, have ;repeatedly failed; to line up enough support behind a party candidate to elect a new speaker of the House.

;

;On Friday, the Biden administration submitted a ;supplementary budget request; to Congress that includes measures to support US commitments under AUKUS.

;

;A senior administration official said Biden would reassure Albanese the US will follow through on its end of the deal as Australians express private frustrations over the delays in moving ahead on the partnership.

;

;"We're in close and deep consultations on Capitol Hill," the official told reporters. "We are confident that the various procedural steps and budget conditions necessary to move forward with pillar one of AUKUS will move through in a way that will support our larger endeavor."

;The US-Australian efforts, designed to counter China's territorial claims and reduce trade dependence on the Asian country, come as both countries also work to reduce diplomatic tensions with Beijing.

;Albanese will visit China, Australia's largest trade partner and biggest buyer of its iron ore, on Nov. 4.

;White House aides are working to lock down a meeting between Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping during the Nov. 11 to 17 Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in San Francisco.

;Biden and Albanese will also seek to boost ;cooperation on cybersecurity; and Australia's rare earth minerals output to reduce reliance on China, the dominant supplier.

;The American Civil Liberties Union on Wednesday urged a US judge to reconsider a partial gag order ;she imposed on Donald Trump; in the case accusing him of trying to overturn his 2020 election defeat, arguing it violates his free speech rights.

;

;"Trump retains a First Amendment right to speech, and the rest of us retain a right to hear what he has to say," the ACLU wrote in an amicus brief filed in US District Court in Washington.

;

;The organization argued that the gag order by US District Judge Tanya Chutkan, which she has ;temporarily lifted;, is “unconstitutionally vague” and covers such a broad range of topics that it would “undermine public discussion on matters of public concern.”

;

;The order bars the former US president and others directly involved in the criminal case from making public statements that target prosecutors, court staff and potential witness in the case. ;

;Chutkan issued the order after finding that ;Trump's social media posts and public comments; risk influencing witnesses and prompting threats and harassment against public officials. Trump has repeatedly referred to Special Jack Smith, who is prosecuting the case, as a “thug” and “deranged.”

;

;Trump, who has criticized the restrictions as a constraint on his presidential campaign, is appealing the order to the US Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit. It is temporarily on hold while Chutkan considers Trump's request for a longer pause.

;

;It is unclear whether Chutkan will consider the ACLU's arguments. The judge has previously denied requests from outside organizations to file briefs in the case.

;

;Trump has ;pleaded not guilty; to the charges in the federal election case, one of four criminal cases he is facing as he runs for president as the frontrunner for the Republican nomination in 2024.

;

;The ACLU has been a vocal critic of Trump and frequently challenged his administration's policies while he was in the White House. ;

;“This isn't the first time that we have said that even Donald Trump's First Amendment rights have to be protected,” said Ben Wizer, the director of the ACLU's Speech, Privacy, and Technology Project. “It's always been our view that if free speech rights don't belong to all, then they don't belong to any.”
